oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Efficient and Stereoselective Nitration of Mono- and Disubstituted Olefins with AgNO2 and TEMPO
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: MAITY, S
MANNA, S
RANA, S
NAVEEN, T
MALLICK, A
MAITI, D
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: ORGANIC-SYNTHESIS
MICHAEL ADDITION
NITROALKENES
NITROOLEFINS
CATALYSIS
HYDROGENATION
CONVENIENT
NITROXIDES
CHEMISTRY
STYRENES
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Nitroolefin is a common and versatile reagent. Its synthesis from olefin is generally limited by the formation of mixture of cis and trans compounds. Here we report that silver nitrite (AgNO2) along with TEMPO can promote the regio- and stereoselective nitration of a broad range of olefins. This work discloses a new and efficient approach wherein starting from olefin, nitroalkane radical formation and subsequent transformations lead to the desired nitroolefin in a stereoselective manner.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: JOURNAL OF THE AMERICAN CHEMICAL SOCIETY, 135(9)3355-3358
